{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3044630,"name":"","username":"Jski21","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/b5e925/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-04-16T02:04:55.702Z","cooked":"

What were some of the best uses of sensors this year? What made the biggest difference for teams. For the sake of discussion let’s exclude the Limelight, or camera based sensors.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-04-16T02:04:55.702Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":427,"readers_count":426,"score":140.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":409006,"topic_slug":"best-sensors-used-in-rapid-react","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38798,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mech and electrical"},"post_url":"/t/best-sensors-used-in-rapid-react/409006/1","custom_user_title":"Mech and electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3044635,"name":"Oliver","username":"ohowe","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ohowe/{size}/221361_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-16T02:17:25.489Z","cooked":"

Revs color sensor worked well for our team and I’m pretty sure a lot of others as well. Auto ejecting wrong color balls was pretty popular this year to help out the drivers. This is all despite all the i2c issues as well.

Rev v3 Color Sensor was a game changer for us. Lifted the timing off of our Co-pilot’s shoulders for indexing the balls into the shooter, and it also allowed us to make a 2 ball auto which was a first.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-04-16T02:17:41.213Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":408,"readers_count":407,"score":116.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":409006,"topic_slug":"best-sensors-used-in-rapid-react","display_username":"Josh Buker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50049,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 4692 | Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/best-sensors-used-in-rapid-react/409006/3","custom_user_title":"FRC 4692 | Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3044642,"name":"Travis Hoffman","username":"Travis_Hoffman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/travis_hoffman/{size}/161072_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-16T02:26:53.528Z","cooked":"
What sensors are you using to index balls? Sensors
3468 had really good luck with these IR Reflection sensors for Infinite Recharge. These are functionally similar to the Adafruit Beam Break sensors, but with both the light and sensor in one unit. So you generally want to detect the presence of light as a reflection from the object rather than the absence of light on the sensor from the object blocking the light. Because you can generally try to mount these fairly close to where the object is being detected, as well as adjust the sensitivity …

We used one of the sensors referenced above for ball detection - it’s been very reliable. And they are 5 VDC and dirt cheap!

Direct link - https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07VKR1GBJ?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_details

Beam breaks to automate our transfer and Rev through bore encoders for more precise control of our flywheels

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-04-16T04:07:39.416Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":297,"readers_count":296,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":409006,"topic_slug":"best-sensors-used-in-rapid-react","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44382,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/best-sensors-used-in-rapid-react/409006/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3044709,"name":"Gavan Davis","username":"gavandavis292","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gavandavis292/{size}/164318_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-16T05:19:00.011Z","cooked":"

We’ve automated our conveyor with an optical sensor at the start and a limit switch at the top. It uses some basic true/false stuff to reload the shooter automatically. The ball passes by the optical sensor in the wider part and rolls over the limit switch in the upper part.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-04-16T05:19:00.011Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":76.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":409006,"topic_slug":"best-sensors-used-in-rapid-react","display_username":"Gavan Davis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49248,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"PantherTech"},"post_url":"/t/best-sensors-used-in-rapid-react/409006/6","custom_user_title":"PantherTech","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3044875,"name":"","username":"Berkeli","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-04-16T18:35:01.662Z","cooked":"

The biggest sensor for us was the integrated encoders in the NEO motors. We were able to do RPM control on our shooter, automate most of our climb, and use path following in auto (with help from the NavX gyro, another fantastic sensor). This is the most encoders we have ever had on a competition bot.
We also use beam break sensors (adafruit 5mm) for ball storage and the Rev color sensors from the 2020/2022 KOP. Both have worked quite well.
Finally, we have a potentiometer on our hood. It’s worked quite well. This has been our best year for software ever, and the sensors we use have a large part in that.
